alert.note: Alert for Western Chester (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 10:26AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Chester County through 1100 AM EDT... At 1025 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Parkesburg, or 11 miles southeast of New Holland, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Coatesville, Parkesburg, Honey Brook, Elverson, Cochranville, Glenmoore and Atglen. This includes Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 300 and 307. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
